title: Bug 108822: More logical processing expected for disk sorting with border value for row value
OB:
When sorting data on disk, if sorting 40,000 rows of data and setting the program to process less than 40,000 rows, the following operations are performed:
1. Save the file as a temporary file
2. Load the file into memory
3. Sort the data
4. Save the sorted data to the temporary file
EB:
When sorting data on disk, if sorting 40,000 rows of data and setting the program to process less than 40,000 rows, the following operations should be performed:
1. Save the file as a temporary file
2. Load the file into memory
3. Sort the data
4. Save the sorted data to the temporary file
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Sort 40,000 rows of data on disk
2. Set the program to process less than 40,000 rows
3. Observe the operations performed (saving file, loading to memory, sorting, saving sorted data)
